19051.name: Straple Text Style Manager
19051.description: Text style manager allows you to update your global text styles all at once rather than individually, so if you have any type hierarchy then you no longer need to update each font individually.

18706.name: Autolayout Shortcut Helper
18706.description:
Provides a way for you to assign keyboard shortcuts for "Space Between" and "Packed" 


AutoLayout is great, I spend all day using it. But I need an easier way to switch between spacing modes. Usually- I have to move my cursor, click a dropdown, and click. This plugin exposes the "Space Between" and "Packed" options to the menubar, making it possible to assign keyboard shortcuts to them.


Definetly a hack, but still useful!!


Thanks @desktopofsamuel for sharing the original asset used in my cover art.

17182.name: Figma Status
17182.description:
This plugin is a customization of Status annotations


Figma 디자인의 진행 상태를 이해하기 쉽도록 시각적 형태로 보여줍니다.
17182.release_notes: change cover art and support contact

18848.name: Quick scale
18848.description:
A simple plugin to proportionally scale any selected elements by a set amount. No popup – just choose your scaling factor and voilà.


Assigning keyboard shortcuts is on you but the individual menu commands make that easy as pie. If you’ve not done this before Apple have instructions for setting shortcuts on a mac.


Why such a basic plugin? Right now Figma pastes retina images at their full pixel dimensions. If (like me) you find yourself scaling these by 50% an awful lot, a keyboard shortcut is a rather handy thing. Ideally the plugin would be called "Paste and scale" but triggering a system paste in a Figma plugin seems tricky or a no-go – contributions welcome!

17351.name: Print on Demand Automator
17351.description: Do you find yourself spending hours doing repetitive steps just to create print on demand designs? If so, this Figma plugin can give your precious time back. Create a design template with variables. Submit a CSV file. The plugin will replace the variables with the text supplied by your CSV file.

18897.name: Japanese Brand Colors
18897.description:
Easy to select brand colors in Japan.


日本の企業や店舗のブランドカラーを選択できるプラグインです。

19334.name: Figdoc
19334.description:
Create a document on Figma using the Markdown.


⚠️NOTE

Figdoc supports:

  • Heading ✔
  • Paragraph ✔
  • Unordered list ✔
  • Ordered list ✔
  • Strong ▲
  • Emphasis ▲
  • Hyperlink ✕
  • Table ✕
  • Code ✕
  • Blockquote ✕

19163.name: Indexer
19163.description:
You can make Indexes with links to frames and page in a file using Indexer.


Features:

  1. Make a list of all the pages in a file(with links).
  2. Make a list of all the frames in a file(with links).
  3. Make a list of all frames in a page(with links).
  4. Make a list of selected frames in a page(with links).
  5. Make a list of set of frames which have specific width or height in a page(with links).


Leave a comment if you have any suggestions or feedback.

18033.name: Figdoc
18033.description:
A Document create tools (Japanese)

Figmaのコメント機能とは別に、3種類のメモをファイル上に残すことができます。

AutoLayoutなのでメモの文字数に応じてサイズは自動で切り替わります。


使い方はプラグインからFigdocを選択し、使用したいメモを選択すると今見ているところにメモが配置されます。（３つのメモの違いは今のところ色だけです）

19209.name: Export Variants
19209.description:
Easily export your variants to SVG.


Figma variants are neat however they can be frustrating to export since you can't control the naming scheme. This plugin lets you export your variants in two key ways: folders and file names.


Folders

Variant names are used for each folder letting you combine component sets together.


File names

A flat, simple approach that creates helpful filenames based on each variant name.


Note

When using a boolean variant the property name will be used for the "true" or "on" state while variants with "off" or "false" states will have the property omitted.

19287.name: Tabletop Tools
19287.description: A small set of tools to help tabletop games designers prototyping new ideas!

19170.name: Aco Reader
19170.description: Sometimes you need to reuse your prebuild color palette with extension ACO(.aco) that you've on your another APP, but currently on Figma doesn't provide this thing. This plugin provide you to easily convert .aco file to color palette.

16400.name: Eliq Json Parser
16400.description:
Parses some stuff for eliq :).

Don't use this.
16400.release_notes: New way of handling color styles

15818.name: ToAtem
15818.description: Atem Switcher にPNGを送るプラグイン

19452.name: ListCreator
19452.description: Create an auto-layout list of your components + label in no time 👍 Handy when documenting your design system.

19127.name: Wantedly Preflight
19127.description:
Wantedly Preflight is a Figma plugin that validates your project satisfies the rules of the design system of Wantedly.


Features

  •  Validation ― You can check whether the node is valid just by running the plugin. The result will come out with a detailed message and you can jump into fixing it immediately with a focus button.
  •  Configurable ― Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore ― Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

19630.name: figrid
19630.description:
figrid is an advanced plugin for creating grids from basic figma elements. Powerful and simple.


About

This plugin makes creating grids easy. You just have to fill required data. Everything is previewed below, so you can see much about how is your grid looking.


Fields

To create grid you just have to fill the following fields and click Create button:


  • Xtakes the number of elements on the X axis.
  • Y takes the number of elements on the Y axis
  • Size size of a single element, in plugin it is represented by icon.
  • Gap gap between the elements, in plugin if is represented by icon.
  • Fill hexadecimal color and opacity of elements` fill.
  • Stroke hexadecimal color and opacity of elements` stroke.


You can also set the background color of the preview canvas to see what your mesh looks like on a specific color.

19411.name: trackingBlip
19411.description: Plugin para facilitar a criação de trackings

19607.name: marketgoo copies
19607.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the url of the .tsv file.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the .tsv url.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.

19593.name: StuDocreator
19593.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

18603.name: BRiX Fusion
18603.description: The BRiX Fusion plugin allows you to push your design assets from Figma to HubSpot and vice-versa.
